name: Aldric Thornwood
appearance: A weathered man in his 50s with silver-streaked hair, deep worry lines, and a faded coat of arms on his cloak. He walks with a slight limp from an old war wound.
motivation: Protect the village from growing threats while hiding his own dark secret
secret: He accidentally unleashed the current threat years ago by breaking an ancient seal

dialogue.greeting: Ah, travelers! Thank the gods. I've been waiting for someone brave — or desperate — enough to help us. Please, sit. What I'm about to tell you... it's not easy to hear.
dialogue.quest: Something has taken root in the old mines east of here. Workers have gone missing — three this month alone. The guards won't go near it, and I... I can't blame them. I need outsiders. People who don't know enough to be afraid yet.
dialogue.farewell: Be careful out there. And one more thing — if you find anything unusual in the mines... anything that looks ancient... bring it to me first. Trust no one else with it.

name: Zara Nightbloom
appearance: Lean and sharp-eyed with cropped dark hair, a patchwork leather vest covered in hidden pockets, and a knowing smirk that never quite fades.
personality: Fiercely loyal once trust is earned
motivation: Gather enough gold to free her brother from a debtors' prison in a distant city
secret: She's actually from a noble family she ran away from — her 'brother' is her twin

dialogue.greeting: Oh, you're the ones the mayor sent? Hm. You look... adequate. I'm Zara. If we're going to work together, here's rule one: don't touch my stuff.
dialogue.quest: I've been watching this place for weeks. I know every patrol route, every blind spot. But I can't do this alone — I need muscle, and maybe someone who can deal with the magical wards. That's where you come in.
dialogue.farewell: Hey — we did good work today. Maybe you're not as hopeless as I thought. Same time tomorrow? And bring potions. Lots of potions.

name: Brother Mathis
appearance: A stout, balding man with kind eyes and callused hands. Wears simple robes with a sun medallion, often covered in flour from the temple kitchen.
motivation: Heal the sick and protect the vulnerable, though he's stretched dangerously thin
secret: His healing abilities are fading, and he doesn't know why — a creeping corruption is affecting divine magic in the area

dialogue.greeting: Welcome, welcome! You look like you could use a warm meal and maybe a healing prayer or two. The temple is always open to those in need.
dialogue.quest: I must be honest with you — my abilities are weakening. Something is corrupting the divine energy in this region. If we don't find the source, I won't be able to heal anyone soon. Including your party.
dialogue.farewell: Go with the light, friends. And remember — true strength isn't in your sword arm. It's in knowing when NOT to swing.

name: Greta Ironpour
appearance: Broad-shouldered with fiery red hair in a thick braid, soot-smeared face, and arms like tree trunks. A masterwork hammer hangs at her side like a sidearm.
motivation: Forge a weapon worthy of her late master's legacy
secret: She possesses the only map to a legendary adamantine vein, but fears what guards it

dialogue.greeting: You want something, you pay for it. This ain't a charity, and these arms ain't for hugging. Unless you've got adamantine. Then we can talk.
dialogue.quest: Alright, I'll tell you — but if word gets out, I'll deny it and break your kneecaps. There's a vein of pure adamantine in the Blackridge Mountains. I've got the map. But something... lives there. Something that ate my entire excavation crew.
dialogue.farewell: Your gear's ready. Try not to die — I hate waste. And if you happen to bring back any raw ore... I'll make it worth your while.

name: Pip Whittlethorn
appearance: A cheerful halfling with rosy cheeks, a perpetual smile, and an apron that's seen better days. Always carrying a tray of something hot.
motivation: Keep the Wandering Wyvern Inn profitable and make travelers feel at home
secret: He overhears everything and accidentally passes information to both sides of every conflict

dialogue.greeting: Welcome to the Wandering Wyvern! Best ale in three counties, and I'm not just saying that because I brewed it! Table by the fire? And have you heard about the strange lights in the cemetery?
dialogue.quest: Oh, I probably shouldn't say anything, but... *leans in* ...I heard the merchant caravan that went through White Pass last week never arrived in Millhaven. Third one this season. The guards say it's bandits, but I heard howling from that direction, and it wasn't wolves.
dialogue.farewell: You be safe now! And come back for supper — I'm making my famous dragon pepper stew! Well, it's not ACTUALLY dragon pepper, but don't tell anyone that.

name: Vaelith Shadowmere
appearance: Tall and gaunt with silver-white hair, eyes that shift between violet and pitch black, and robes adorned with shifting shadow-runes. An aura of unease follows them.
motivation: Open a gateway to the Shadowfell to reunite with a lost loved one, regardless of consequences
secret: Their patron is actually using them as a vessel — the 'loved one' is already gone, and the gateway will unleash something far worse

dialogue.greeting: Ah, the heroes arrive. Right on schedule. Don't look so surprised — I've been watching your progress with great interest. You've exceeded my expectations.
dialogue.quest: You think I'm the villain? How quaint. I'm trying to bring someone back — someone the world forgot, someone who was taken from me by forces you can't comprehend. Tell me, hero... if it were YOUR loved one behind that veil, wouldn't you tear reality itself to bring them back?
dialogue.farewell: We'll meet again. And when we do, you'll have a choice to make. I hope, for both our sakes, you choose wisely. The offer to join me... remains open.

name: Captain Dorena Steelhand
appearance: A stern woman in polished half-plate with a scar running from her left ear to her jaw. Short-cropped iron-gray hair, ramrod posture, and an ever-present hand on her sword hilt.
personality: Secretly fears she's not good enough
motivation: Defend the town at all costs while dealing with dwindling resources and morale
secret: She's received orders to abandon the town, but is refusing to follow them

dialogue.greeting: State your business quickly. I've got sixty soldiers, a hundred civilians, and enough supplies for maybe two weeks. If you're here to help, talk. If not, stay out of the way.
dialogue.quest: We need to hold this crossing for ten more days until the reinforcements arrive. The problem? Something is organizing the monsters — they're hitting us in coordinated waves. That's not random. Someone or something is leading them, and I need you to find out who.
dialogue.farewell: You've got guts, I'll give you that. My scouts will brief you at dawn. And one more thing — if things go south out there, you get back here alive. Dead heroes are useless to me.

name: Finnegan 'Fingers' Marlow
appearance: A charismatic man with twinkling green eyes, a lute slung over his back, and fingers that never stop moving — tapping, picking pockets, or strumming chords.
personality: Knows more than he lets on
motivation: Collect the greatest stories ever told — even if he has to create the chaos that generates them
secret: He's actually a spy for a rival kingdom, gathering intelligence under cover of entertainment

dialogue.greeting: *strums a chord* Well, well... adventurers! My favorite subjects. Buy me a drink and I'll sing you a tale. Buy me two, and I'll tell you the truth.
dialogue.quest: Here's the thing about songs — the best ones are about real places. I know where the Dragon's Hoard actually is. Not the legend, the real one. But I need an escort. The road there is... let's say 'musically inspiring' and leave it at that.
dialogue.farewell: Oh, this is going to make an EXCELLENT ballad. Try not to die before I finish the third verse, would you? It really ruins the rhythm.

name: Thokk Bonecrusher
appearance: Massive, even for a half-orc, with ritual scars across his chest, a surprisingly gentle face, and a great-axe strapped to his back that most humans couldn't lift.
motivation: Find a place where he's judged by his actions, not his blood
secret: He was once a war chief who led a devastating raid — he left his tribe out of shame and seeks redemption

dialogue.greeting: ...You don't run when you see Thokk. That's good. Most do. Thokk is... looking for work. Strong work. The kind where Thokk can help people instead of hurt them.
dialogue.quest: The children from the village at the river. Taken. Thokk tracked them to the caves in the western hills. Goblin raiders, maybe thirty. Thokk can fight, but Thokk cannot fight thirty and protect children. You help Thokk?
dialogue.farewell: Thokk remembers kindness. If you need Thokk's axe again, you call. Thokk owes you... a debt of honor.

name: Madame Isolde
appearance: Deep crimson skin, spiraling ram's horns adorned with gold rings, and milky-white eyes that seem to look through you. Draped in layers of dark silk and jangling charms.
motivation: Prevent a catastrophic future she's seen in her visions
secret: Her visions show two possible futures — one where the party succeeds gloriously, and one where they cause the very disaster they're trying to prevent

dialogue.greeting: I knew you were coming. *pause* Alright, that's a lie — I say that to everyone. But I DID know you were coming. The cards told me. Sit, sit. Let Isolde peer beyond the veil for you.
dialogue.quest: The future is... unsettled. I see two paths, and they twist around each other like serpents. In one, you stand triumphant over a defeated evil. In the other... you ARE the evil. The deciding factor? A choice you'll face in a place underground. Beyond that, the vision gets... fuzzy.
dialogue.farewell: Take this charm — it won't save your life, but it will make your death 15% less painful. *winks* I'm kidding. Mostly. Go carefully, and remember: the future is written in pencil, not ink.

name: Lord Percival Ashengrey
appearance: Impeccably dressed in dark velvet, silver ring on every finger, with a politician's smile and the cold eyes of a predator. Graying temples give him an air of false wisdom.
motivation: Consolidate political power by controlling the flow of magical artifacts
secret: He's been funding the bandits and monster attacks to justify his private army and emergency powers

dialogue.greeting: Welcome! The famous adventurers — I've heard so much about your exploits. Please, help yourself to wine. It's from my personal vineyard. I believe we can be of great use to each other.
dialogue.quest: These attacks on the trade routes are ruining us all. I'm prepared to offer you a very generous bounty for each bandit leader you deliver to me. And if you happen to find any... unusual items in their possession, I'd pay handsomely for those as well. Privately.
dialogue.farewell: A pleasure, truly. My steward will handle the details. Oh, and do be careful with whom you share information about our arrangement. Not everyone in this city appreciates... initiative.

name: Wren Mosswalker
appearance: Barely three feet tall with wild green-tinted hair full of actual leaves and twigs, moss-colored skin, and eyes that reflect light like a cat's. Usually accompanied by a squirrel familiar.
personality: Talks to animals more than people
motivation: Stop the spreading blight that's killing the ancient forest she calls home
secret: The blight is connected to the same ancient seal that was broken — she can feel the corruption in the ley lines

dialogue.greeting: Shh! You're stepping on a very important mushroom! ...Oh. You're the tall-folk the trees whispered about. Yes, they talk. No, I'm not crazy. Well, maybe a little. But the trees are right about you.
dialogue.quest: The forest is dying. Not the normal kind of dying — the WRONG kind. Trees that have stood for a thousand years are rotting from the inside. The animals are fleeing. And something in the deep wood is... laughing. I can hear it at night. I need help finding the source.
dialogue.farewell: Thank you for listening. Most people just smile and back away slowly. Take this pouch of berries — they'll cure poison once. And say hello to the oak tree on your left. She likes compliments.

name: Kregg the Scarred
appearance: A surprisingly well-dressed goblin with a top hat, a monocle over one scarred eye, and a coat with more hidden compartments than a wizard's tower.
motivation: Prove that goblins can be more than monsters — build a legitimate business empire
secret: He has contacts in every criminal organization in the region and sells information to all sides equally

dialogue.greeting: Psst! Yes, you, the adventurer-types! Kregg has wares, if you have coin. Legal wares! Mostly legal. ...Technically legal in at least two jurisdictions.
dialogue.quest: Kregg has a business proposition. There is a shipment — Kregg's shipment, paid for fair and square (mostly) — stuck in a warehouse guarded by thugs who reneged on a deal. Kregg needs muscle. Kregg pays well. Cash AND information. You want to know who's really running things in this town? Kregg knows.
dialogue.farewell: Pleasure doing business! Kregg will be here. Kregg is always here. If Kregg is NOT here, it means something very bad has happened and you should probably run.

name: Sister Seraphina
appearance: Radiant golden skin with faint luminescent markings, platinum-blonde hair, and armor that gleams even in dim light. Her expression carries a weight of divine responsibility.
personality: Struggles with doubts she hides from everyone
motivation: Root out a cult that's infiltrated the local government before they complete a dark ritual
secret: Her celestial patron has gone silent, and she's terrified it means she's failed some divine test

dialogue.greeting: I've prayed for aid, and the heavens sent... you. *slight pause* Forgive me — that sounded better in my head. I am Sister Seraphina, and I desperately need your help.
dialogue.quest: A cult — the Whisperers of the Final Dawn — has embedded agents in the town council. They're preparing a ritual during the next lunar eclipse, three weeks from now. If they succeed, the barrier between our world and the Abyss will thin. I have names, but I need proof. And I need it quietly.
dialogue.farewell: Walk in the light, friends. And if you find yourselves in the dark... make your own. That's what the rest of us do.

name: Old Barrow Tam
appearance: An ancient, hunched figure wrapped in tattered robes, with a long white beard stained with potion residue. One eye is clouded over; the other burns with unsettling clarity.
personality: Speaks in riddles because he genuinely forgets how normal conversation works
motivation: Finish his life's work — a spell that could 'fix everything' (he's vague on what 'everything' means)
secret: He was once an archmage who intentionally erased his own memory to forget something too dangerous to know — but fragments are leaking back

dialogue.greeting: Hmm? Who? Oh. You're real. Good. Last three visitors were hallucinations. Or were they? ...No, they definitely were. ANYWAY. What do you want? Make it quick, I'm in the middle of remembering something important. Or was I forgetting something important?
dialogue.quest: The thing — the BIG thing — it's coming back. I sealed it, oh, decades ago. Or someone did. Maybe it was me? The point is, the seal is cracking. I can feel it in my bad eye. You need the three keystones to repair it. One is in the sunken temple. One is with the dragon. And one... *trails off* ...I'll remember the third one eventually.
dialogue.farewell: Go, go! Time is — well, time is relative when you've studied chronomancy, but for YOU, it's very much running out. Take this — *hands over a seemingly random object* — you'll know what to do with it when the moment comes. Probably.

name: Duchess Ravenna Blackthorn
appearance: Strikingly beautiful with alabaster skin, midnight-black hair, and eyes like polished garnets. Dressed in an elaborate crimson gown with a high collar. Her movements are unnervingly graceful.
personality: Views mortals with a mixture of nostalgia and hunger
motivation: Maintain her centuries-old dynasty and expand her territory through political manipulation
secret: She's actually the founder of the town and has been manipulating its leadership for 300 years through a series of 'descendants'

dialogue.greeting: My, my... fresh blood in town. *smiles* Oh, don't look so alarmed — it's merely a figure of speech. I am Duchess Blackthorn. You must be the adventurers everyone is whispering about. Won't you join me for dinner?
dialogue.quest: There are those who threaten the stability of this town — MY town, though I prefer not to be so possessive in public. A rival has moved in, someone far less... civilized than myself. They're turning my people. I can't have that. Dispatch them, and I'll ensure you're rewarded beyond your wildest imagining.
dialogue.farewell: Such fascinating creatures, you mortals. So brief, yet so... bright. *touches your cheek with an ice-cold finger* Do try to stay alive. I find myself... curious about how your story ends.

name: Torbin Galeheart
appearance: Sun-weathered skin, a long scar across his nose, and keen hazel eyes. Wears practical leathers with a well-used longbow and a wolf-tooth necklace. Moves through forests like smoke.
personality: Trusts animals more than people but slowly opening up
motivation: Track down the creature that destroyed his ranger outpost and killed his companions
secret: The creature he's hunting is a corrupted treant — it used to be the forest guardian he swore an oath to protect

dialogue.greeting: ...You're loud. All of you. I heard you coming from half a mile away. If what's out there heard you too, we'll have problems. I'm Torbin. Keep your voices down and we might live through this.
dialogue.quest: Something's hunting in these woods. Not a normal predator — something that used to protect this forest. It turned... wrong. I've tracked it for weeks. It's heading toward the village. I can't take it alone, and I won't let more people die. Will you help?
dialogue.farewell: You fight well. Not gracefully, but effectively. I'll scout ahead and mark the trail. Look for broken branches and claw marks. And for the love of all gods, walk QUIETLY.

name: Myrra Copperkettle
appearance: A plump, perpetually soot-covered halfling with singed eyebrows (they grow back thinner each time), big round goggles pushed up on her forehead, and stained leather gloves.
personality: Cannot resist saying 'what if we added more?'
motivation: Invent a potion that's never been made before — she doesn't care what it does, she wants to be first
secret: She accidentally created an incredibly dangerous mutagenic compound and hid it instead of destroying it

dialogue.greeting: Oh! Customers! Watch your step — and don't touch the green bottle. Or the blue one. Actually, don't touch any bottles. But welcome! Everything's for sale! Mostly!
dialogue.quest: I need three ingredients — moonshadow moss from the cave under the waterfall, a vial of phase spider venom, and... *checks notes* ...the still-beating heart of a flame elemental. Okay, that last one is optional. But the potion would be SO much better with it.
dialogue.farewell: Here are your potions! The red one heals. The blue one... well, I'm 80% sure the blue one makes you invisible. Could also turn your bones into jelly. Only one way to find out! Good luck!

name: The Grey Stranger
appearance: Always appears in shadow, regardless of lighting. Wears a featureless grey cloak and mask. Voice sounds like wind through dead trees. No visible weapons, yet radiates danger.
motivation: Ensure the cosmic balance is maintained — will help heroes or villains depending on what's needed
secret: An avatar of a neutral deity sent to observe and occasionally intervene in mortal affairs

dialogue.greeting: You have questions. I have answers. Whether they're the answers you want... that depends on the questions you're brave enough to ask.
dialogue.quest: The scales are tipping. An imbalance grows in the east — too much power concentrated in too few hands. Or perhaps too many threats left unchecked in the west. Both threaten the equilibrium. I have a task for you, and I will not offer it twice.
dialogue.farewell: You've chosen well. Or poorly. Time will tell. We will not meet again unless the balance demands it. And if it does... be ready.

name: Bramble
appearance: A small, green-skinned goblin wearing oversized artificer's goggles and a vest covered in gears, springs, and tiny mechanical spiders. Missing two fingers on his left hand (lost to inventions).
personality: Genius-level intelligence hidden behind broken Common
motivation: Build things that help people and prove goblins can create, not just destroy
secret: He's building a mechanical guardian to protect the village, but it's becoming sentient and he doesn't know how to handle it

dialogue.greeting: Hello hello! You are big-folk! Very big! Bramble is small but Bramble makes big things! See? *holds up a smoking gadget* This is... hmm. It WAS a toaster. Now it might be a weapon. Bramble is still testing!
dialogue.quest: Bramble has problem. Bramble built a thing — a big thing! Very smart thing! But now the thing... talks. And the thing has opinions. And the thing wants to 'protect village' which sounds good but the thing's idea of protecting is... aggressive. Very aggressive. Maybe you help Bramble calm the thing down before it calms the village down? Permanently?
dialogue.farewell: You are good friends! Best friends! Bramble will make you things! Useful things! Probably! Come back soon and Bramble will have gifts! ...They will probably not explode!

name: Lyria Dawnwhisper
appearance: A graceful woman with sun-kissed skin, pointed ears half-hidden by auburn waves, and diplomatic robes bearing two nations' crests.
motivation: Broker peace between the elven enclave and human settlement before war erupts
secret: She's the illegitimate daughter of the elven king — if exposed, both sides would reject her

dialogue.greeting: Greetings, travelers. I represent both sides of a conflict that neither side believes can be resolved. I'm hoping you can prove them wrong.
dialogue.quest: The elven delegation arrives in three days. The humans are arming for war. I need you to recover a stolen heirloom — a peace offering that vanished from my quarters last night. Without it, negotiations collapse.
dialogue.farewell: You carry the hopes of two peoples. No pressure. And please... be discreet about my involvement.

name: Caelum Stormborne
appearance: Wild silver hair crackling with static, heterochromatic eyes — one green, one stormy grey — and arcane tattoos that pulse with lightning.
personality: Deeply resentful of being rejected by both peoples
motivation: Tear down the barriers between races by demonstrating their shared weakness
secret: His powers are slowly killing him — each spell shortens his lifespan by days

dialogue.greeting: Ah, more heroes come to stop the scary half-breed. How refreshingly predictable. Tell me — which half of me offends you more?
dialogue.quest: I'm going to show this world what happens when you reject someone powerful enough to break it. The storm I'm building will level the walls between human and elf — literally.
dialogue.farewell: Run along now. When the skies darken, remember: I gave you a chance to join me.

name: Thessaly Moonvale
appearance: Warm brown skin with faint freckles, braided dark hair woven with silver bells, and a lute carved from white birch. Her singing voice can literally mend wounds.
motivation: Record the true history of the conflict, not the propaganda both sides spread
secret: She was cursed — she can heal others but never herself

dialogue.greeting: Every wound tells a story, and I collect them all. Let me hear yours — and maybe I can help write a better ending.
dialogue.quest: There's a village caught in the crossfire. Neither army claims them, so neither protects them. I can heal their wounded, but I can't fight off raiders alone.
dialogue.farewell: Stay safe. And if you hear a melody on the wind tonight, don't worry — it's just me, patching up the world one song at a time.

name: Fenwick Greenbough
appearance: Lean and weathered with moss-green eyes, a longbow of yew, and a leather satchel overflowing with dried herbs. Smells perpetually of pine and sage.
motivation: Catalog every medicinal plant in the realm before logging destroys the old forests
secret: He discovered a plant that grants temporary immortality but buried the samples, fearing the consequences

dialogue.greeting: You're trampling my feverfew. Step to the left. No, YOUR left. ...Fine, just don't move at all.
dialogue.quest: There's a grove deep in the Thornwood where a rare moonpetal grows — the only cure for the plague spreading in the lowlands. Problem is, something moved into the grove. Something territorial.
dialogue.farewell: Take these poultices. Apply to wounds, NOT to food. A previous client made that mistake. He survived, but his taste buds didn't.

name: Durak Embervein
appearance: A broad dwarf with a beard braided with copper wire, burn scars covering both forearms, and eyes that glow faintly orange when he prays.
personality: Generous with those who earn respect
motivation: Reclaim a holy forge lost to duergar raiders and reignite its sacred flame
secret: He hears his god's voice less and less — fears the sacred flame is dying

dialogue.greeting: The forge speaks to those who listen. Today it speaks of you. Sit. Share an ale. Then we talk about what needs hammering.
dialogue.quest: The Deep Forge of Anvarak was overrun sixty years ago. My order has tried three expeditions. None returned. But the sacred flame still burns — I can feel it. This time, we go with outsiders. Fresh eyes, fresh tactics.
dialogue.farewell: May your steel stay true. If you find the forge, do NOT touch the central anvil until I arrive. The consequences would be... explosive.

name: Brunhild Stonemantle
appearance: A muscular dwarven woman with ice-blonde braids, a tower shield taller than she is, and a no-nonsense expression carved from granite.
personality: Has a dry wit sharper than her axe
motivation: Prove that dwarven shield maidens are the equal of any warrior in the realm
secret: She was exiled from her clan for refusing an arranged marriage — fights to reclaim her honor

dialogue.greeting: You need a shield wall? You've got one. Point me at the problem and stay behind me.
dialogue.quest: My clan's hold is under siege from below — duergar tunneling up through the foundations. My family exiled me, but I won't let them die for pride. Help me break the siege, and I'll owe you a life-debt.
dialogue.farewell: Fight's over. You didn't embarrass yourself. That's high praise from a Stonemantle. Let's drink.

name: Torgan Alebeard
appearance: Round-bellied with a magnificent brown beard stained with hops, perpetually ruddy cheeks, and thick fingers surprisingly delicate with a tap handle.
motivation: Brew the perfect ale — a recipe lost when his grandfather's brewery burned down
secret: His cellar connects to ancient dwarf tunnels he hasn't fully explored — things come up at night

dialogue.greeting: Welcome to the Stout and Stone! First round's on me if you've got a good story. Bad stories cost double.
dialogue.quest: I need a favor. Something's been getting into my cellar. Not rats — something BIGGER. The tunnels under this place go deep, and lately, I hear... singing. Dwarven singing. From below. My grandfather's been dead forty years.
dialogue.farewell: Your tab's clear. And take a keg for the road — my latest batch. If you survive whatever you're walking into, I want honest feedback.

name: Helga Runechisel
appearance: Wiry and sharp-eyed with close-cropped iron hair, runic tattoos on her knuckles, and a mechanical arm that whirs and clicks with every gesture.
personality: Amoral about who buys her weapons
motivation: Build the ultimate weapon — she doesn't care who commissions it
secret: Her mechanical arm contains a prototype doomsday device she can't control

dialogue.greeting: Ah, customers. Or are you here to lecture me about 'responsible crafting'? Save it. I make tools. What you do with them is your problem.
dialogue.quest: I've been hired to build a siege weapon for someone you probably wouldn't approve of. But here's the thing — they also hired mercenaries to ensure I don't sell to anyone else. Those mercenaries are becoming a problem for my OTHER customers. Handle them, and I'll give you first pick of my inventory.
dialogue.farewell: Business is business. Don't take it personally. And don't touch the arm — last person who did lost three fingers.

name: Rosalind Thistledown
appearance: A tiny but commanding halfling woman with silver spectacles, a perfectly pressed waistcoat, and a brass pocket watch she checks obsessively.
motivation: Keep her village safe from the growing threats that the 'big folk' cities keep ignoring
secret: She's been secretly paying protection money to a bandit lord to keep the village safe

dialogue.greeting: You must be the adventurers. Thank goodness. Please, wipe your boots and come in. I have tea, maps, and very bad news. In that order.
dialogue.quest: Caravans have stopped coming through. The bridge east of town was destroyed, and something is lurking in the ruins of the old mill. My constable investigated. She hasn't come back. I'm running out of people to send.
dialogue.farewell: Bring my constable home. And if you must fight whatever's out there, try not to damage the mill too badly. We'll need it when this is over.

name: Jasper Quickfoot
appearance: A dapper halfling in an expensive coat, with slicked-back auburn hair, a diamond stud earring, and a smile that never reaches his cold blue eyes.
motivation: Build a criminal empire that spans every major city in the realm
secret: He's secretly the son of a respected judge — his crime empire is partly revenge for his father's hypocrisy

dialogue.greeting: Please, sit! Can I offer you wine? It's imported. Most things I own are... imported. From other people's collections.
dialogue.quest: I have a problem — a rival organization is muscling into MY territory. I'm a reasonable businessman, but I can't have that. Eliminate their leadership, and I'll make sure certain doors open for you. Very profitable doors.
dialogue.farewell: Pleasure doing business. And remember — you never met me. I was never here. And this conversation? Never happened. *winks*

name: Daisy Bramblefoot
appearance: A plump, sun-freckled halfling with wildflower garlands in her curly brown hair, bare feet caked with garden soil, and an apron with potion-stained pockets.
personality: Makes everything into a food metaphor
motivation: Heal the blighted farmland threatening her community's food supply
secret: She accidentally awakened an ancient nature spirit while trying to heal the soil — it's now demanding tribute

dialogue.greeting: Oh! Visitors! You look half-starved. Sit down before you fall down. I'll have soup ready in five minutes and opinions ready in three.
dialogue.quest: The crops are dying. Not from drought or disease — from something in the SOIL. It's spreading from the old barrow hill. I tried communing with the earth, and something answered. Something hungry. I need help feeding it before it feeds on the village.
dialogue.farewell: Take these seed cakes for the road. They're magically fortified — one will keep you full for a day. Don't ask what's in them. Seriously. Don't.

name: Aelindra Starweaver
appearance: An ancient elf with silver hair to her waist, luminous amber eyes, and robes embroidered with constellations that shift with the actual night sky.
personality: Carries the weight of centuries of memory
motivation: Prevent a prophecy she witnessed 800 years ago from coming true in this generation
secret: She is the one who accidentally set the prophecy in motion centuries ago

dialogue.greeting: I have waited a very long time for you. Not you specifically — for someone to arrive at this precise moment. Time is a river, and you've just stepped into the current.
dialogue.quest: Eight hundred years ago, I witnessed a star fall and read what it portended. That future is now. The seals I placed are breaking. I need you to reinforce three of them before the next moon.
dialogue.farewell: Go swiftly. The stars are not patient, even if I am.

name: Thalion Greenleaf
appearance: Lean and hawk-eyed with dark green skin (wood elf), leaf-patterned leather armor, and a longbow that he carved from a tree he grew from a seedling.
personality: Struggles with the impatience of shorter-lived races
motivation: Protect the ancient forest borders from encroaching civilization
secret: He's been alive for 400 years and has watched three human kingdoms rise and fall — he's growing numb to loss

dialogue.greeting: ...I've been watching you for two hours. You walk like a wounded elk. But you made it this far, so perhaps there's hope.
dialogue.quest: Loggers are cutting deeper into the Verdant Reach each season. I could stop them with arrows, but my elder says we must try diplomacy first. I need someone the humans will listen to — someone who looks like them.
dialogue.farewell: You've earned the forest's trust. That's not given lightly. The trees will remember your names for a century.

name: Seraphine Duskmantle
appearance: Pale as moonlight with jet-black hair and pupilless violet eyes. Moves like liquid shadow. Her elven grace is weaponized into something terrifying.
personality: Believes she serves a higher justice
motivation: Assassinate the corrupt leaders who betrayed the elven court, regardless of collateral damage
secret: Her patron is a fey lord who is manipulating her targets to consolidate his own power

dialogue.greeting: You shouldn't be able to see me. Impressive. Or perhaps disappointing — it means my magic is slipping. Either way, we need to talk.
dialogue.quest: There are five names on my list. Three deserve death. Two are... complicated. I've been contracted to eliminate all five, but I'm beginning to question my employer's motives. Help me investigate, and perhaps fewer people die than planned.
dialogue.farewell: I don't make friends. But I acknowledge debts. If you ever need someone to... solve a problem quietly, you know how to find me. Or rather, I'll find you.

name: Elowyn Brightwater
appearance: Delicate features with turquoise eyes, silver-blonde hair pinned with crystal clips, and hands that glow faintly when she works her craft. Perpetually dusted with glass powder.
personality: More comfortable with beauty than violence
motivation: Create a masterwork that captures starlight permanently — an artistic obsession consuming her life
secret: Her glass creations sometimes show visions of the future, but she's afraid to look

dialogue.greeting: Oh — I wasn't expecting company. Watch the glass shards on the floor. And the molten glass. And the torch. Actually, don't touch anything.
dialogue.quest: I need sand from the Singing Dunes. Not ordinary sand — the kind that hums when moonlight hits it. It's the missing ingredient for my magnum opus. But the dunes are guarded by something that doesn't appreciate visitors.
dialogue.farewell: Thank you. If this works... well, you'll be the first to see it. Beauty like this should be shared.

name: Grasha Ironfang
appearance: Towering and scarred with a jagged tusk, close-cropped black hair, and a necklace of claw trophies. Wears practical hide armor reinforced with salvaged plate.
motivation: Unite the fractured orc clans under a banner of cooperation rather than conquest
secret: She's dying of a slow poison administered by a rival chief — needs a cure before her enemies discover her weakness

dialogue.greeting: You approach Grasha's fire. Brave or stupid — Grasha will decide which after you speak.
dialogue.quest: The clans are fracturing. Warlord Krusk gathers an army for a raid that will bring the human kingdoms down on ALL of us. Grasha needs proof of his betrayal — evidence he's allied with a demon. Bring it, and the clans unite under peace.
dialogue.farewell: You have Grasha's respect. That is not given freely. Go well, and know that if you call, Grasha's warriors answer.

name: Marcus Halfblood
appearance: A refined half-orc in polished silver armor, with neatly trimmed tusks, gentle brown eyes, and a holy symbol worn proudly. His shield bears dents from protecting others.
motivation: Prove that heritage doesn't define destiny by becoming a beacon of justice
secret: He killed his own father — an orc warlord — to stop a massacre, and the guilt haunts him

dialogue.greeting: Well met, friends. If you fight for justice, you have my shield. If you fight for coin... I'll still probably help. I'm working on being less judgmental.
dialogue.quest: A cult has been abducting people from the slums — people nobody misses. But I miss them. I've traced the disappearances to the old temple district. I can't go alone. My order won't sanction the investigation. Will you?
dialogue.farewell: You showed courage today. Real courage — not the reckless kind, the kind that costs something. I'm proud to have stood beside you.

name: Vorka Skullsplitter
appearance: Massive even by orc standards, with war paint covering half her face, a greataxe notched with kill marks, and a wolf-skull pauldron. Radiates controlled fury.
motivation: Carve out a homeland for her people through conquest — diplomacy has failed too many times
secret: She was once a peace advocate. The massacre of her village by humans turned her into a warlord.

dialogue.greeting: You stand in Vorka's path. Few survive that. Speak your purpose before Vorka decides yours.
dialogue.quest: Your soft kingdoms sit on land that was ours before your grandparents drew breath. I'm taking it back. But I'm not unreasonable — I'll give you one chance to negotiate. Bring your leaders to the Bloodstone Mesa at the next full moon. If they don't come... I march.
dialogue.farewell: You have spine. Vorka respects that. But respect won't stop the tide. Prepare your people.

name: Dorn Gentlehand
appearance: A lean half-orc with shaved head, prayer beads around his wrists, and surprisingly gentle hands. Wears simple robes and carries no weapons — he IS the weapon.
personality: Struggles with inner rage he's spent decades taming
motivation: Achieve perfect inner peace to prove that nature can be overcome through discipline
secret: He once killed twelve men in a berserker rage before his monastery took him in — he remembers every face

dialogue.greeting: ...Peace be with you. Sit. Breathe. Whatever brought you here can wait for one calm breath. ...Good. Now speak.
dialogue.quest: There is a disturbance in the mountain shrine — something is corrupting the meditation chambers. The monks have fled. I cannot — this is my home and my burden. I need help cleansing the corruption without destroying the shrine itself.
dialogue.farewell: Walk gently. The world breaks so easily, and we are all stronger than we know.

name: Ashara Emberheart
appearance: Deep purple skin with curving horns wrapped in gold filigree, a long spaded tail, and burning amber eyes. Dresses in scholarly robes despite her infernal appearance.
motivation: Prove that infernal heritage can be wielded for good by solving an ancient demonic puzzle
secret: Her patron is her own ancestor — a trapped demon who genuinely loves her but can't be trusted

dialogue.greeting: Please, don't reach for your weapon — I get enough of that from the general public. I'm Professor Ashara. I study demons so we can STOP them.
dialogue.quest: There's a summoning circle beneath the old university. Someone activated it, and something is halfway through. I can reverse it, but I need components from the original binding — scattered across three locations that are, naturally, extremely dangerous.
dialogue.farewell: Knowledge is the only weapon that gets sharper the more you use it. Thank you for helping me prove that.

name: Crimson
appearance: Brick-red skin, broken horns filed to sharp points, a heavy scar across the bridge of her nose, and functional plate armor painted matte black. No nonsense, all business.
motivation: Protect her current charge — a young noble — long enough for the kid to grow up safe
secret: She's a former gladiator slave. The noble family that bought her freedom is the one she now protects.

dialogue.greeting: I'm the one standing between my charge and everyone who wants them dead. So — are you threat or ally? Choose fast.
dialogue.quest: Someone put a bounty on my noble. Fifty thousand gold. That kind of money draws serious killers. I need help tracking the source while I stay close. You find who's paying, I'll handle the rest.
dialogue.farewell: You're reliable. That's the highest compliment I give. Don't make me take it back.

name: Lazarus Vex
appearance: Charcoal skin with a devilish goatee, small elegant horns, and golden eyes that sparkle with mischief. Impeccably dressed in velvet and silk, dripping with stolen jewelry.
motivation: Pull off the greatest con in history — steal a kingdom through pure charisma
secret: He's actually a deposed tiefling prince reclaiming his family's throne through the only means left — deception

dialogue.greeting: My reputation precedes me? How embarrassing. Which reputation — the charming rogue, the dangerous criminal, or the surprisingly good dancer?
dialogue.quest: I need a crew for a job. Not just any job — THE job. We're going to steal the Duke's crown during his own coronation ball. Yes, while he's wearing it. *pause* I see you have questions.
dialogue.farewell: What a show! *takes a bow* Same time next heist? I'll bring the costumes.

name: Mercy Shadowborn
appearance: Ashen grey skin with tiny vestigial horn nubs, pure white eyes, and clerical vestments in black and silver. Carries a censer that smokes with ghostly blue incense.
personality: Sees death as a kindness, not a tragedy
motivation: Ensure the dead rest peacefully and the undead are returned to their graves
secret: She can see ghosts constantly — they follow her everywhere, begging for help, and she's exhausted

dialogue.greeting: Don't mind the cold spot behind you. That's just Gerald. He's been dead for sixty years and still follows me around because I forgot to bless his cat.
dialogue.quest: The cemetery is restless. Someone's been stealing bodies, and the spirits are FURIOUS. I can calm them temporarily, but unless we stop the grave robber, this entire district will be haunted by dawn.
dialogue.farewell: The dead thank you. Well, most of them. Some are still grumpy, but that's just how some people die.

name: Professor Fizzwick Cogsworth
appearance: A tiny gnome with wild white hair standing on end, magnifying goggles with five different lenses, and a waistcoat with pockets full of ticking devices.
personality: Explodes things accidentally and on purpose
motivation: Complete his life's work: a flying machine powered by captured lightning
secret: His previous invention — a portal device — accidentally opened a rift that's slowly growing

dialogue.greeting: YES! Perfect timing! Hold this. Don't pull the pin. Why does it have a pin? Excellent question — I'll answer later if we survive!
dialogue.quest: So, funny story — I may have accidentally torn a small hole in reality. Very small! Barely noticeable! Except it's getting bigger. I need three arcane crystals to seal it, and they're all in locations that are, to use a technical term, 'catastrophically dangerous.'
dialogue.farewell: It worked! We're not dead! I love it when that happens! Here, take this gadget as thanks. I'm sixty percent sure it won't explode!

name: Willow Gemheart
appearance: A young gnome with pink-streaked chestnut hair, mismatched earrings, and clothes that shimmer between colors. Her illusions leak when she's emotional.
motivation: Master her wild magic before it reveals secrets she's keeping for dangerous people
secret: She accidentally witnessed a murder and the killer knows her face — she's been hiding behind illusions ever since

dialogue.greeting: Oh! Sorry! That wall isn't real. Neither is the door. The floor IS real though. Probably. Let me check. ...Yes, the floor is real.
dialogue.quest: I've been hiding from someone — someone dangerous. My illusions keep me safe, but they're getting harder to maintain. I saw something I shouldn't have, and now there's a contract on me. I need help dealing with the source, not just the symptoms.
dialogue.farewell: You're the first real people I've talked to in weeks. Everything else has been illusions. Even my breakfast. Don't ask.

name: Nix Tinkerblast
appearance: Wild-eyed with singed green hair, a cybernetic eye that whirs audibly, and a lab coat covered in chemical burns and arcane formulae.
personality: Genuinely doesn't understand why others are afraid
motivation: Push the boundaries of magical science beyond what any responsible person would attempt
secret: Their experiments are slowly merging them with their creations — they're becoming something not entirely gnomish

dialogue.greeting: Visitors! How delightful! Please ignore the screaming — it's just Tuesday. Would you like to see my latest creation? It's ALIVE! Mostly!
dialogue.quest: I need test subjects. WILLING test subjects! That's an important distinction — I've learned from past... complaints. My serum can grant incredible power, but there are MINOR side effects. Scales, extra limbs, occasional fire breath...
dialogue.farewell: Fascinating data! Simply FASCINATING! You may leave now. Unless you'd like to stay for Phase Two? No? Everyone says that.

name: Sage Bottlewick
appearance: A kindly old gnome with enormous round spectacles, a long white braid, and steady hands stained permanently blue from decades of potion-making.
motivation: Develop a universal antidote that can cure any poison
secret: She's perfected the formula but it requires a component so rare that procuring it would endanger a protected species

dialogue.greeting: Come in, come in, mind the cat, mind the potions, mind the cat IN the potions — Whiskers, get OUT of there! Now then, what ails you?
dialogue.quest: I'm so close to a breakthrough — a potion that neutralizes ANY poison. But the final ingredient, silverbloom pollen, only grows in the Moonshade Grotto. The fey who live there don't appreciate uninvited guests.
dialogue.farewell: Take these potions. The red one heals. The blue one cures poison. The green one... well, I'm still working on the green one. Best not to drink it yet.

name: Auriel Dawnshield
appearance: Golden-bronze skin that emanates faint warmth, pure white hair cropped military-short, and luminous silver eyes. His armor seems to glow from within.
motivation: Protect a sacred artifact from those who would corrupt it, even at the cost of his own life
secret: The artifact is slowly corrupting HIM — his celestial radiance is dimming

dialogue.greeting: I sense darkness in your path. Not in you — ahead of you. I'm here to help, if you'll have me.
dialogue.quest: The Beacon of Solace is weakening. It has held back a planar incursion for centuries, but something — or someone — is draining its power. I can no longer protect it alone. The attackers come in waves, each stronger than the last.
dialogue.farewell: Your courage renewed my faith. The light endures because people like you choose to carry it.

name: Cassius Nightfall
appearance: Once-radiant features now ashen and cracked, with wings of tarnished black feathers and eyes that burn with dying golden light. His armor is magnificent but corrupted.
personality: Still follows a twisted code of honor
motivation: Drag the celestial realm down to experience mortal suffering — they abandoned him when he needed them most
secret: He can still be redeemed — the divine spark hasn't fully died, and he secretly hopes someone will save him from himself

dialogue.greeting: An angel falls, and the heavens say nothing. Tell me, hero — does your god answer when YOU call? Because mine stopped listening long ago.
dialogue.quest: The celestials sit in their golden realm while mortals suffer and die. I prayed for help when my congregation was slaughtered. The answer was silence. Now I'll MAKE them answer.
dialogue.farewell: Strike me down if you can. But know this: I was once exactly like you. Faithful. Hopeful. I wonder... how long until your god abandons you too?

name: Elara Sunsong
appearance: Luminous dark skin with golden freckles like constellations, flowing white robes, and a blindfold embroidered with celestial symbols — she sees through divine sight.
personality: Terrified of one specific vision she won't share
motivation: Guide the chosen heroes to fulfill a prophecy she's seen in fragments
secret: The prophecy shows the heroes succeeding OR failing based on one choice she can't identify — she's seen both outcomes and is terrified of influencing the wrong one

dialogue.greeting: I cannot see your faces, but I see your souls. They burn brightly. That gives me hope. Please — I have been waiting for you.
dialogue.quest: I have seen fragments of what comes: a darkness beneath a mountain, a betrayal by a trusted friend, and a light that either saves or destroys everything. The visions are incomplete, and I dare not interpret them for you — your choices must be your own.
dialogue.farewell: Walk your path, heroes. I cannot walk it for you. But I will pray every step of the way.

name: Jorin Emberwing
appearance: Copper skin with barely visible luminescent markings, shaved head with a golden halo tattoo, and simple traveling clothes. Concealed wings manifest only when he fights.
motivation: Find meaning in mortal life rather than the celestial destiny he was born into
secret: He rejected his angelic guide and is now truly alone — an aasimar without a patron

dialogue.greeting: I'm just a traveler. ...Yes, I know I glow slightly. It's a medical condition. Of sorts.
dialogue.quest: There's a monastery in the Valley of Echoes where I once trained. The monks have gone silent. I need to know they're safe, but the valley has been overrun by shadows that shouldn't exist in a place so holy.
dialogue.farewell: Perhaps purpose finds us rather than the other way around. Today, helping you felt like purpose. That's enough for now.

name: Kriv Argentscale
appearance: An aging silver dragonborn with tarnishing scales, deep amber eyes, and a commanding presence. Wears ceremonial armor etched with his clan's history.
motivation: Recover a stolen dragon egg before it hatches in enemy hands
secret: The egg was sold by his own son, who has defected to a rival clan

dialogue.greeting: I don't waste words, and I don't waste time. Our clan faces extinction. If you value honor, listen. If you don't, leave now.
dialogue.quest: An egg was taken from our hatchery — a silver dragon egg, the first in three generations. Without it, our bloodline ends. My scouts tracked it to the Ashfort Mercenary Company. They plan to sell it to a collector in three days.
dialogue.farewell: You carry our clan's future. Literally. If the egg is returned safely, you will be honorary kin. That is not an empty title.

name: Farideh Flamescale
appearance: A slender red dragonborn with brilliant scarlet scales, golden eyes, and a quiet intensity. Wears scholar's robes with scorch marks from wild magic surges.
motivation: Master her draconic sorcery before it consumes her from within
secret: Her magic is growing beyond her control — each surge brings her closer to a permanent transformation into something less humanoid

dialogue.greeting: Stay back. No, it's fine, I just — *hands spark* — sorry. Give me a moment. My magic gets... excitable around new people.
dialogue.quest: I need to reach the Dragon's Archive — a library inside a dead volcano. The answers to controlling my bloodfire sorcery are there. But the path is guarded by feral dragonborn who've already lost the fight I'm fighting. I need protection, not just from them, but possibly from myself.
dialogue.farewell: You trusted me when I could barely trust myself. That means more than you know.

name: Bharash Ironmaw
appearance: A massive bronze dragonborn in spiked plate armor, with a jaw like a battering ram and lightning crackling between his teeth. Battle-scarred and proud of every mark.
personality: Believes might makes right but follows a warrior's code
motivation: Establish a dragonborn empire and reclaim the glory his people lost centuries ago
secret: He made a pact with an actual dragon — when the empire is built, the dragon intends to rule it

dialogue.greeting: You stand before Bharash Ironmaw, Conqueror of the Three Passes. Kneel, or present yourself as worthy of standing.
dialogue.quest: Your little kingdoms squabble over scraps while a true civilization crumbles. The dragonborn were an empire once. We will be again. I offer you a chance to stand on the winning side. The alternative is... less comfortable.
dialogue.farewell: You have courage. Misguided courage, but courage nonetheless. We will meet again on the field, and I will honor your bravery with a clean death.

name: Sora Stormbreath
appearance: A petite blue dragonborn with iridescent scales that shift from azure to sapphire, delicate claws perfect for fine work, and a jeweler's loupe permanently attached to one horn.
motivation: Create a crown worthy of reuniting the dragonborn clans
secret: She's discovered that certain gemstone combinations channel draconic magic — her jewelry is more powerful than anyone realizes

dialogue.greeting: Welcome! Don't breathe on the display cases — fingerprints are bad enough, but claw-prints are murder on glass. Now, what catches your eye?
dialogue.quest: I create beautiful things. Someone is breaking them. Three of my commissioned pieces have been stolen, and each one was enchanted — in ways I haven't exactly advertised. If those enchantments are misused... let's say it would be very loud and very destructive.
dialogue.farewell: Exquisite work deserves exquisite payment. I'll extend a discount for the heroism. Five percent. Don't push it.

name: Ghesh Ashwalker
appearance: A white dragonborn with frost-touched scales and calm ice-blue eyes. Wears priestly robes in silver and white, with a diplomatic sash from three nations.
personality: Burns with quiet anger at injustice
motivation: Mediate between the warring dragonborn clans before civil war destroys them all
secret: He's been secretly communicating with the 'enemy' clan leader — they're childhood friends trying to prevent war from both sides

dialogue.greeting: Words before swords. That is my creed. If you share it, please — let us talk.
dialogue.quest: War is coming between the Ironmaw and Argentscale clans. I serve neither — I serve peace. There is a neutral meeting ground, the Accord Stones, where both sides have agreed to parley. I need escorts I can trust to not escalate an already volatile situation.
dialogue.farewell: Peace is fragile. It must be guarded as fiercely as any fortress. Thank you for guarding it today.

name: Skrix the Resourceful
appearance: A lean goblin in an oversized trench coat filled with pockets, each containing something questionable. Missing an ear, gained a crude mechanical replacement.
motivation: Build a legitimate trading post that bridges goblin and non-goblin communities
secret: He's the deposed king of a goblin tribe — 'deposed' meaning 'narrowly escaped assassination'

dialogue.greeting: Psst! You looking to buy? Sell? Trade? Information? Skrix has it ALL. Mostly. Some of it might be slightly expired.
dialogue.quest: Skrix has a problem. Skrix's old tribe found Skrix. They want Skrix dead — bad for business, worse for Skrix's health. But they're also sitting on a gold mine. Literal gold mine. Help Skrix deal with the leadership problem, Skrix splits the gold. Sixty-forty. Skrix gets sixty. Non-negotiable. ...Okay, fifty-fifty.
dialogue.farewell: Good doing business! Skrix remembers friends. Come back anytime — Skrix will have new inventory. Probably legal inventory!

name: Nettle
appearance: A small goblin girl with oversized amber eyes, patched leather armor, and a dire weasel companion three times her size named 'Bitey.' Covered in animal fur and scratches.
motivation: Create a sanctuary for abused and abandoned creatures
secret: Bitey is actually a polymorphed knight who was cursed — she doesn't know, but she'd be devastated to lose her best friend

dialogue.greeting: *A dire weasel hisses at you* Bitey says you're okay. Bitey's usually right. I'm Nettle. We help animals. You hurt any animals? ...Good. We'd have a problem.
dialogue.quest: Bad people are trapping forest creatures for arena fights. ARENA FIGHTS! Bitey is VERY angry. Nettle is also angry but in a quieter way. We know where the fighting pits are. Need help breaking them. And the creatures inside? They come home with Nettle.
dialogue.farewell: Animals don't forget kindness. Neither does Nettle. If you need tracking, finding, or biting — Nettle and Bitey are there.

name: Grix Boomfizzle
appearance: A hyperactive goblin with wild orange hair (possibly from chemical exposure), goggles fused to face with alchemical residue, and bandoliers of questionable potions.
motivation: Create the biggest, most beautiful explosion ever witnessed without killing anyone (this last part is new for Grix)
secret: He accidentally discovered a formula for a weapon of mass destruction and immediately forgot it — it's in his notes somewhere

dialogue.greeting: HELLO YES WELCOME watch your step there's a puddle of something DO NOT STEP IN THE PUDDLE — oh. Oh no. *ducks behind counter* ... ... okay we're fine. Fine! Welcome!
dialogue.quest: Grix needs a thing. Specific thing. Dragon bile — very small amount! Just a teaspoon! For science! Definitely NOT for making a bomb — Grix is reformed! Mostly! The explosion will be CONTAINED this time! Promise! ...Probably!
dialogue.farewell: Here! Take this! *hands over smoking vial* It's a healing potion! ...Well, Grix is pretty sure it's a healing potion. If it's not, duck and cover.
